channel.title: Tutorial Request : IP Changing
channel.description:
Please Could anyone link me to a tutorial on ip changing. Or even tell me themselves.
I read on another forum that you could get a program that changed your ip at the click of a button without having to use all these different programs to search for working ips etc. (which never worked for me)
I would really appreiciate this. If this board cannot be used for requests then please lock my topic. I read the stickies about rules but im really tired and didn't see anything about no requests. Sorry.

item.title: Tutorial Request : IP Changing
item.dc:creator: @biggmax biggmax
item.description:
@biggmax wrote:

Okay here is the real way to make sure you get a new IP:
Get a phone
Call your ISP
Tell them you care being hacked and need a new IP
Done.

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial Request : IP Changing
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Ok, to get a new IP adress you need to disconect from the internet inorder to flush everything about your current IP adress and so when you reconnect it can’t find your data on the old IP adress so it gives you a new one.

[size=1pt]I have no idea how it works really that just seems pretty logical, anyway, using a proxy dosen’t give you a new IP adress, if you do find a way to get a new IP, not proxy, not hide IP platinum(that gives you a proxy) then pm me.[/size]

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial Request : IP Changing
item.dc:creator: @armanie14 armanie14
item.description:
@armanie14 wrote:

I tried that already, but it crashes my internet. i need somthing that changes it instantly with no internet crash

hide ip platinum or whatever looks good i need the pay version though.

any serials or anything for it around?

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial Request : IP Changing
item.dc:creator: @poopy4231 poopy4231
item.description:
@poopy4231 wrote:

goto command prompt and type in

/release

/renew

then it changes it

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial Request : IP Changing
item.dc:creator: @armanie14 armanie14
item.description:
@armanie14 wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:2, topic:6378”]No tutorial requests, but here is how you change your IP in Windows XP.

You can change your IP with a click, by using a program called Hide IP Platinum or Anonymizer. You can search for torrents on them or whatever. Sorry, but I’m moving this, since it’s not a tutorial. :P[/quote]

Ron, would the torrents be the paid for version? That looks ezactly like what i want.

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial Request : IP Changing
item.dc:creator: @l3etal3lade l3etal3lade
item.description:
@l3etal3lade wrote:

Mine can’t do it from the traybar… I’m using Netgear but that just brings up like information on packets sent to and from it and all the graphs and data and info about the company lol… damn Netgear.

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial Request : IP Changing
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I can do that too but it’s better if you have it on constant, gives it time to cool down.

In the tray bar you can also restart it there

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial Request : IP Changing
item.dc:creator: @l3etal3lade l3etal3lade
item.description:
@l3etal3lade wrote:

The Un-Named:

If your on a router, disconect all power going into the router(in other words, unplug it), wait 5 mintues and turn it back on.

Lol I don’t have to wait 5 mins on mine I can just go into the control panel of it and restart it and viola.

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial Request : IP Changing
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

If your on a router, disconect all power going into the router(in other words, unplug it), wait 5 mintues and turn it back on.

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial Request : IP Changing
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

No tutorial requests, but here is how you change your IP in Windows XP.

You can change your IP with a click, by using a program called Hide IP Platinum or Anonymizer. You can search for torrents on them or whatever. Sorry, but I’m moving this, since it’s not a tutorial.

Read full topic
